result.execSummary:
The defendant Desiree C Pierce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Desiree C Pierce is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Desiree C Pierce was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; STRAIGHT TIME
**10-25-15, Order commuting term of probation to one year**

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay related surcharge. Pay a fine of $400.00 plus court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected during term of probation; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment. If defendant gets revoked, fine due immediately.

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Obtain GED or HSED.
- Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
- No Contact with Walmart located at 10330 W Silver Spring Drive.
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- No alcohol or controlled substances.

records.addlTxt: Order Commuting Term of Probation and Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and file.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to the amended charge.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on the amended charge and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.    

The Court sentenced defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, consecutive to any other sentence straight time, with credit for 2 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEAR with the following conditions:
-Defendant to pay a fine in the amount of $400.00 PLUS Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected during term of probation;  nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  If defendant gets revoked, find due immediately
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No contact with Walmart located at 10330 W. Silver Spring Drive
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Defendant Desiree C Pierce in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on Motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 amended to Retail Theft, pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 943.50 (1m)(b), a Class A Misdemeanor and COUNT 2 DISMISSED.

Defendant Desiree C Pierce in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to Court's congested calendar, matter rescheduled for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Desiree C Pierce in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared via telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date after the defendant's misdemeanor case is resolved in the end of July.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Desiree C Pierce in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Have not received offer.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Desiree C Pierce in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 6/2/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Desiree C Pierce in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Desiree C Pierce in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
